tasks.task: Setting up a brooder for mail-order day-old chicks.
subtasks: Verify the number of chicks to determine the appropriate wattage of the brooder reflector lamp (125 watts for every 25 chicks).
Install a red bulb in the reflector lamp to warm the air around the chicks without producing excessive light.

Position the reflector lamp in the brooder to maintain the temperature at 100-105 degrees Fahrenheit at floor level when chicks arrive, as they require significant warmth due to lower body mass and stress from transit.
Monitor chick behavior to adjust the temperature: chicks huddled indicate it's too cold, while those sleeping distant areas suggest proper warmth; as chicks grow, reduce heat incrementally.
Transition to non-light-producing heat sources (e.g., heat plates) after 7-10 days of age, but not suitable for initial arrival.
